acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] WalIndex::record_event does not accept an unused request_sha256 parameter.
- [ ] Call sites and tests updated; no unused variables remain.
description:
**Problem**
WalIndexTxn::record_event accepts request_sha256 but immediately discards it (let _ = request_sha256). Callers still pass a value, implying it is stored. This hides information loss and is confusing (error_design principle: preserve info until an explicit boundary).

**Files:** src/daemon/wal/index.rs, src/daemon/executor.rs, src/daemon/core.rs
design:
**Design**
- Remove request_sha256 from the WalIndex trait method signature and all call sites, OR store it in the events table if it is truly needed.
- Prefer removal (spec says request_sha256 belongs to client_requests; event index is for WAL offsets).
- Update tests and any documentation/comments accordingly.
title: Remove unused request_sha256 from WalIndex::record_event
